contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=May 2008}} In [[baseball]], '''middle relief pitchers''' (or "middle relievers") are [[relief pitcher]]s who commonly pitch in the fifth, sixth, or seventh [[inning]]s.<ref>{{cite book|last=Dickson |first=Paul |authorlink=Paul Dickson | title=The Dickson Baseball Dictionary |year=2009| publisher=[[W. W. Norton & Company]] |page=544| isbn=978-0-393-06681-4}}</ref> In the [[National League]], a middle reliever often comes in after the starting pitcher has been pulled for a [[pinch hitter]]. A middle reliever is usually replaced in the eighth or ninth innings by a [[left-handed specialist]], [[setup pitcher]] or [[closer (baseball)|closers]]; middle relief pitchers may work these innings as well, especially if the game is not close. == References == {{Portal|Baseball}} {{Reflist}} {{BaseballPositions}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Middle Relief Pitcher}} [[Category:Baseball pitching]] [[Category:Baseball strategy]]
